weaana 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Get Started

Statistics weather records by a certain period and function

Source: R/wapply.R
wapply-WeaAna-method.Rd

wapply is a powerful and flexible function to statistics weather records. It could be used to calculate multiple variables with different functions and different parameters for all levels in a certain period.

# S4 method for WeaAna
wapply(
  object,
  vars,
  period,
  FUN,
  ARGS = NULL,
  site.ARGS = NULL,
  res.name = "result",
  yrange = waGetPara("yrange"),
  as.data.frame = FALSE,
  extra = NULL
)

Arguments

object

A WeaAna objects.
vars

A variable vector to apply FUN.
period

A period to apply FUN. It could be one of "year", "month", "week", "day", or any number of day.
FUN

A function vector to be applied.
ARGS

Optional arguments to FUN.
site.ARGS

Arguments for each site
res.name

A result name to store and return.
yrange

Year range to statistics.
as.data.frame

Logical, if TRUE, a data frame will be returned, but just a period supported. if FALSE, a list will be returned.
extra

A list or data.frame whose elements have the same length of sites

Details

vars could be a vector to list all variables which need to calculate. Available variables could be obtained through function getAvaiVars.

period could be one of "year", "month", "week", "day", or any number of day. It will be complicated to the same length of vars.

FUN could be a vector. FUN will be replicated to the same length as vars. Each FUN will be applied to each vars as the sequence of vars.

Optional arguments args is a list which have the same length as FUN. Each element of args is the optional arguments for each FUN. Each argument will be replicated to same length as level number which determines by period. Then, each level will be passed to different parameter.

Examples

library(weaana)
data( "records" ) 
# calculate yearly mean temperature
wapply( records, vars = "avgt", period = "year", FUN = mean )

#>                    Name  Number Latitude Longitude year   result

# yearly mean temperature
wapply( records, vars = "avgt", period = "year", FUN = mean )

# yearly mean temperature, total raifall and mean radiation.
wapply( records, vars = c( "avgt", "rain", "radn" ), 
        period = "year", 
        FUN = c( mean, sum ), 
        res.name = c( "mean.avgt", "total.rain", "mean.radn" ) )

#> 106 DEMO Weather Site 2 0000002      -25       130 2009  19.05479

# calculate thermal time from last frost day to first heat day for year range 1960 to 2009
last.frost <- lastFrostDay( records, yrange = c( 1960, 2009 ) )
first.heat <- firstHeatDay( records, yrange = c( 1960, 2009 ) )
wapply( records, vars = "avgt", period = "year", FUN = function ( x, start, end, base = 0 )
{
            if ( is.na( start ) | is.na( end ) )
            {
                return( NA )
            } else
            {
                x <- x[ seq( start, end )]
                x <- x[ x > base ] - base
                return( sum( x, na.rm = TRUE ) )
            }
        }, ARGS = list( list( start = last.frost[,6], end = first.heat[,6] ) ), 
        res.name = "tt", yrange = c( 1960, 2009 ) )

#>                  Name  Number Latitude Longitude year     tt
#> 1 DEMO Weather Site 1 0000001      -25       135 1960 933.95
#> 2 DEMO Weather Site 1 0000001      -25       135 2009 521.50
#> 3 DEMO Weather Site 2 0000002      -25       130 1960 933.95
#> 4 DEMO Weather Site 2 0000002      -25       130 2009 521.50
